From Zero to Passion

I’m Kelvin Fernando, a User Experience designer, coder, and storyteller focused on human-centered design.

From being a medical student (Asian mom’s choice), I decided to build my own path and pursued arts where I gained my Bachelor’s degree in Journalism. Hungry for more, I traveled to Montreal, Canada and completed web design and programming. I never thought I could help people with design as much as in the medical field until I discovered UX. For the first time in my life, I knew what I wanted to become.

Hat tip to people who made me

My greatest teachers were from youtube, podcasts and online courses. In no particular order, I present you the god’s gift to creative people.

Joe Natoli and LearnUX.io. Their UX course opened the gates for me.
Chris Do and TheFutur staff (even you Eren).
The Design Better podcast and it’s guests. Benjamin Evan’s Inclusive design is probably my favorite episode.
Gary Simons of DesignCourse. If you’re looking for a design to code, look no further.
Brad Traversy and Maximilian Schwarzmüller. Youtube and Udemy Code gods.
Chris Sean, Joshua Fluke, TechLead, and ShopTalkShow for everyday code inspiration.
Charli, Jesse, and Alexa , for everyday design inspiration.

Books under my pillow

These books were the firestarter and are what keeps my burning passion for design alive (figuratively).

  • The Design of Everyday Things
  • Universal Principles of Design
  • Don’t make me think
  • Rocket Surgery Made Easy
  • The Non-Designer’s Design Book
  • 100 Things Every Designer Needs to Know About People
  • The Elements of User Experience
  • Psychology of Everyday Pricing
This portfolio is also dedicated to my dad who supports me and my mom. A janitor turned architect, a good husband, and the best father.
